column4: hey, if i have ubuntu one one HDD and want to move it to a HDD that already has Windows installed, how can i do this?
i have to clean install or can i use some partition program to do it
could you be more specific?  do you want to keep windows and share the drive?  or screw windows and you just want to copy your ubuntu install from your old drive to a new one?
the easiest way is to just reinstall ubuntu on the smaller drive... it should automatically shrink the windows partition and use the free space, then blow away the ubuntu partition on the big drive
ok, if it doesnt work im gonna come on via live cd and kick your ass :p
